content:
ugh the steps in the program and still not have
the relevant understanding. And what works for Chinese would also work
for other mental phenomena. I could, for example, go through the steps of
the thirst-simulating program without feeling thirsty. The argument also,
en passant,refutes the Turing test because it shows that a system, namely
me,  could  pass  the  Turing  test  without  having  the  appropriate  mental
states.*. . .
The  details  of  how  the  brain  works  are  immensely  complica
